about_the_game:
Slavic Winter Simulator is an authentic experience that recreates the celebration of New Year among residents of the post-Soviet space in the 2000s, offering nostalgic emotions. Throw snowballs at your in-game friends, enjoy the magical atmosphere of New Year from the 2000s, and relive the carefree days of childhood.

In this game, you can expect:

  • Photorealistic graphics on Unreal Engine, utilizing photogrammetry and Nanite technology.

  • A courtyard, stairwell, and several apartments to explore. No loading screens, just a single seamless world.

  • Light up sparklers, launch fireworks. To light a sparkler, hold it to a working gas stove burner.

  • Play on a console.

  • Climb into other people's apartments via balconies.

  • Knock on neighbors' doors and wish them a Happy New Year. You can knock on over 30 apartments.

  • All items in the apartment are interactive: TV, gas stove, water taps, light switches, cupboards, doors, clothing.

  • Before leaving the house, you need to put on shoes and a jacket.

  • You can wear a Christmas hat of Grandfather Frost / Santa.

  • You can eat tangerines, pies, and cakes.

  • You can throw snowballs at the guys in the yard.

  • Cars drive along the streets.

  • If you throw a snowball at a car, its alarm will go off.

  • The magical atmosphere of childhood New Year celebrations.

  • Views from the windows of panel buildings.

  • 3D graphics.

  • First-person perspective.

  • "Fish-eye", "VHS", and pixel art modes.
